intro: Galium rzedowskii, commonly known as the Rzedowsky's bedstraw, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its small, white or pale pink flowers are clustered in umbels, and it has opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Galium rzedowskii is characterized by its slender stems and is often found in high-altitude habitats.
